document.docAuthor: Krolow, Tiago Kütter & Henriques, Augusto Loureiro
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the New World genus Chlorotabanus Lutz, 1913 (Diptera: Tabanidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the New World genus Chlorotabanus Lutz, 1913 (Diptera: Tabanidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality:
Brazil (AP, Serra do Navio).
Diagnosis: Medium size ( 12.8–16.5 mm ), snow-white thorax, greenish-yellow abdomen. Eyes with narrow, elongate frons (F.I. 6.0– 7.7 ). Antenna with elongate basal plate about 2.5 x stylus length.

Redescription ( Holotype
Ψ ) : Body length 14.3 mm (
Fig. 7
A–B); wing length 13.2 mm ; wing width 4.4 mm .

Head (
Fig. 7
C): Black eyes. Narrow, elongate frons, slightly convergent towards base, F.I. 7.7 , D.I. 1.5 , snow-white pruinosity, white hairs. Subcallus, gena, parafacialia and face with pruinosity as frons. Gena, parafacialia and face with dense white hairs and subcallus with less dense hairs. Palpus yellow; first segment of palpus with white hairs, second segment with yellow hairs and some black hairs on the anterior region. Proboscis with greenish-yellow theca; black labella. Antenna (
Fig. 7
D): scape yellow with white and yellow hairs; pedicel yellow with yellow hairs; flagellum greenish-yellow without pilosity except for some hairs on the dorsal elevation of the basal plate and on the stylus; elongate basal plate (B.P.I. 1.6 ) about 2.5 x stylus length (Flg.I. 2.5 ).

Thorax: Scutum with orangish integument, with snow-white pruinosity (in all views), snow-white hairs and a few black hairs on the notopleural lobe and the mid-posterior region of scutum; scutellum, post-pronotal lobe, post-alar callus and pleura with snow-white pruinosity and pilosity. Slender legs; coxae (anterior region 2 / 3 ) with pruinosity and pilosity as thorax, posterior 1 / 3 with yellowish pilosity; trochanters, femora, tibiae and tarsomeres greenish-yellow with yellow pilosity, except at the dorsal apex of fore tibia, with few black hairs and the 2 / 3 of the hind tibia (in dorsal view) with two rows of black hairs to the last tarsomere. Hyaline wing (
Fig. 7
E), yellowish, except for the darkened-yellow basal costal and costal cells. Greenish-yellow veins, except for the darkening of the transverse veins; costal vein with yellow hairs and some black hairs; no appendix at the fork in the R 4 + 5 vein; greenish pterostigma; alular incisions with black spot.
Abdomen: Dark yellowish with green pigments, covered by shiny yellow hairs except beginning at the fifth tergite, where distal transversal bands of black hairs; sternites similar to tergites.

Variations: Eyes vary from grayish, bronzy, dark red to black; pedicel can have thick black hairs; appendix in R 4 + 5 vein often absent and when present, usually poorly developed. Some specimens have a distal transversal band of black hairs on the first tergite. Body length 12.8–16.5 mm (X = 14.4 mm , N = 20 ); wing length 11–13.5 mm (X = 11.9 mm , N = 20 ); wing width 3.5–4.5 mm (X = 4.0 mm, N = 20 ); F.I. 6.0– 7.7 (X = 6.7 , N = 20 ); D.I. 1.3–1.5 (X = 1.3 , N = 20 ); B.P.I. 1.5–1.8 (X = 1.6 , N = 20 ); Flg.I. 2.1–3.3 (X = 2.5 , N = 20 ).
Male
: as
Krolow & Henriques ( 2008 )
.

Distribution: Colombia , Venezuela , Guyana , Brazil (Amapá, Amazonas, Pará, Maranhão, Rondônia).
Holotype
Ψ: deposited in the MZSP . In good condition, except the loss of the apical extremity of the left wing.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Chlorotabanus leucochlorus
(A–C Holotype Ψ; D–E Ψ): A–B, Body (dorsal and lateral views); C, Head (frontal view); D, Antenna (lateral view); E, Wing (dorsal view).

Discussion:
C. leucochlorus
is easily distinguished from the rest due to the thorax covered with snowwhite pruinosity and hairs in addition to some black hairs on the notopleural lobe.
